author: Special Correspondent
text:
Activists of 'Thaneer' plucking out nails from a tree in Tiruchi on Sunday as part of a campaign to rid all trees of nails.— PHOTO: B. VELANKANNI RAJ

A special drive to protect the trees was organised here on Sunday. Volunteers of ‘Thanner’, a service organisation, cleared the trees of nails and banners and flex-boards during a special drive. “Trees located at thoroughfares or at the junction areas bear the brunt of the nails and act as a platform for advertisers to set up hoardings,” says M. Sekaran, who inaugurated the “clean the nails” drive on the Gandhi Mandapam premises.

Nails of different sizes and shapes were removed. They could collect nails weighing about 3 kg. “This is the first part of the programme and we will continue it in other parts of the city,” said K.C. Neelamegam, secretary of ‘Thanner’.

Interestingly, most of the hoardings containing slogans ‘plant the trees and harvest rain water’ (Maram naduvom – mazhai peeruvom) had been nailed on the trees.

Mr. Sekaran said that nails caused more harm than good to the trees and hence the drive.
title: Volunteers rid trees of nails
